title: AB 1673
content: The people of the State of California enact the following. Section 16520 of the Penal Code is amended to define a "firearm" as a device designed for weapon use that expels a projectile through a barrel by the force of combustion. The definition includes the frame or receiver of the weapon in various sections of the code. The summarized chunk includes various sections of the Penal Code related to firearms, welfare, and institutions, ranging from Section 16550 to Section 8103. The summarized chunk includes sections of the Penal Code related to firearms, welfare, and institutions, ranging from Section 16550 to Section 8103. It also defines "firearm" to include rocket launchers and similar devices containing explosive materials in specific provisions. The Penal Code sections from 16750 to 26055 define "firearm" to include rocket launchers and similar devices with explosive materials, excluding unloaded antique firearms in specific provisions. The Penal Code sections from 26030 to 29150 list various provisions related to firearms, excluding unloaded antique firearms in specific provisions. The Penal Code sections from 26030 to 29150 cover provisions related to firearms, excluding unloaded antique firearms in specific provisions. This includes regulations on firearms in different sections such as 26400, 26500-26588, 26700-26915, 27510, 27530, 27540, 27545, 27555-27585, 29010-29150, 25135, 34005, and 34010. Additionally, the definition of "firearm" varies in sections 17280, 24680, and 922 of Title 18 of the United States Code. The Penal Code sections from 26030 to 29150 cover provisions related to firearms, excluding unloaded antique firearms. Definitions of "firearm" vary in different sections, including regulations on unfinished frames or receivers that can be converted to functional condition. In Penal Code sections 29010 to 29150, "firearm" includes unfinished frames or receivers that can be easily converted to a functional state. The terms "frame" and "receiver" refer to the part of a firearm that houses the firing mechanism and barrel, including blanks or machined bodies designed for use in a functional weapon. Section 1.1 of the bill incorporates amendments to Section 16520 of the Penal Code, contingent on the enactment of Senate Bill 894 and certain conditions being met by January 1, 2017. Section 1.2 of the bill includes amendments to Section 16520 of the Penal Code, dependent on the enactment of Senate Bill 1407 and Assembly Bill 857 by January 1, 2017, with specific conditions to be met for it to become operative. Section 1.3 of the bill incorporates amendments to Section 16520 of the Penal Code, contingent on the enactment of multiple bills by January 1, 2017, with specific conditions for it to become operative. No reimbursement required by this act under California Constitution as it pertains to creating, eliminating, or changing penalties for crimes or infractions.
